text: Paul Olfelt House is a Usonian style house designed by Frank Lloyd Wright in St. Louis Park, Minnesota, at the outskirts of Minneapolis. It was designed in 1958 and completed in 1960 as a residence for Paul and Helen Olfelt, who commissioned both the building and the interior design from the architect. The house, constructed mainly of brick and stone, has the area of and includes three bedrooms and two bathrooms. In 2017 the house was put up for sale for $1,395,000.00 == References == * Storrer, William Allin. The Frank Lloyd Wright Companion. title: Paul Olfelt House
